items.title: Breaking: Man sentenced to life in prison for assassination of Japan's Shinzo Abe
items.description: Tetsuya Yamagami pleaded guilty to fatally shooting Mr Abe as he stood surrounded by security, media and supporters in 2022.

items.title: Police slap bans on neo-Nazis entering Sydney CBD on Australia Day
items.description: Up to 12 neo-Nazis have been issued public safety orders banning them from entering central Sydney, shutting down plans to attend anti-immigration rallies on Australia Day.

items.title: Australia's NATO envoy is returning home with a warning about North Korea
items.description: Australia's outgoing military envoy to NATO is preparing to return to Canberra after two years in the role, and she is coming home with a warning.

items.title: Canadian PM Mark Carney speaks out against Trump at the World Economic Forum
items.description: Canadian PM Mark Carney told the World Economic Forum "middle powers must act together".

items.title: Beijing has a nickname for Trump: The Chinese 'nation-builder'
items.description: Inside China, there's a nickname for Donald Trump that tells you everything you need to know about how the US leader's actions are increasingly seen as a gift to Beijing.

items.title: Australian shark attack data reveals where bite incidents happen most
items.description: An ABC analysis of the national Shark-Incident Database shows that the average number of verified shark bite incidents recorded annually over a decade has increased every 10 years since the 1950s.

items.title: Canada models guerrilla warfare response to US invasion

featured_image.name: Canada prepping response to hypothetical US military invasion for first time in a century, report says

items.description:
The Canadian Armed Forces have modeled a hypothetical U.S. military invasion of Canada and potential responses employing unconventional warfare tactics, The Globe and Mail reported on Tuesday, marking the first time in approximately 100 years that such scenarios have been war-gamed by Canada's military.

According to two senior government officials who spoke to The Globe and Mail, military planners are simulating a U.S. invasion from the south, anticipating American forces could overwhelm Canada's strategic defenses on land and at sea within as little as two days. The officials emphasized, however, that a U.S. invasion remains highly improbable.[1][2][3][4][5]

items.title: Webb telescope captures dying star's fate and black hole's feeding

featured_image.name: ESA - Webb reveals Helix Nebula in glistening detail

items.description: NASA released stunning new images from the James Webb Space Telescope on Tuesday, including a detailed look at the Helix Nebula that offers a glimpse into the eventual fate of our own Sun. Meanwhile, separate observations captured a supermassive black hole in the Circinus Galaxy actively consuming surrounding material, overturning decades of assumptions about how such cosmic giants feed.

items.title: Trump and Putin envoys hold first talks on Ukraine at Davos
items.description:
Envoys for U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin met for approximately two hours in Davos on Tuesday to discuss a potential peace deal for Ukraine, with both sides characterizing the discussions as positive and constructive—even as key obstacles to ending Europe's deadliest conflict since World War II remain unresolved.

The meeting at "USA House" on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum brought together Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner with Kremlin representative Kirill Dmitriev, marking the first time a senior Russian official has publicly engaged at the Swiss gathering since the forum froze ties with Moscow following the 2022 invasion of Ukraine.[1][2][3]

items.title: Trump says NATO would be 'ash heap of history' without him

featured_image.name: Trump highlights NATO contributions but challenges allies' commitment

items.description:
President Donald Trump declared on Tuesday that NATO would be "in the ash heap of history" without his leadership, as European leaders rallied to oppose his push to acquire Greenland and his threat to impose escalating tariffs on eight allied nations.

"No single person, or President, has done more for NATO than President Donald J. Trump. If I didn't come along, there would be no NATO right now!!! It would have been in the ash heap of History," Trump wrote on Truth Social. In the same post, he added, "Sad, but TRUE!!!"[1][2][3]

The remarks came just hours before Trump departed for the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, where European leaders assembled to present a united front against his territorial ambitions.

items.title: IAEA chief warns Iran may be declared in nuclear treaty violation

featured_image.name: Rafael Mariano Grossi at World Economic Forum 2025 (018905 ...

items.description:
As tensions between Washington and Tehran continue to escalate amid a violent crackdown on nationwide protests, arms control experts are sounding alarms about the security of Iran's near-weapons-grade uranium stockpile, warning that months of blocked inspections have created a dangerous void in international oversight.

The International Atomic Energy Agency has been unable to verify the status of an estimated 440.9 kilograms of uranium enriched to 60 percent purity—close to the roughly 90 percent considered weapons-grade—since U.S. and Israeli airstrikes struck key nuclear facilities in June 2025. That stockpile, according to IAEA standards, is theoretically enough material for 10 nuclear bombs if further enriched.[1][2][3]

items.title: Second Spanish train derails near Barcelona, multiple injured

featured_image.name: Spain invests almost £2 billion in rail infrastructure ...

items.description: A commuter train derailed near Barcelona on Tuesday after a containment wall collapsed onto the tracks, injuring 15 passengers, Spanish emergency authorities said. The incident comes just two days after a catastrophic high-speed train collision in southern Spain killed more than 40 people.

items.title: Live: Ley warns shadow cabinet solidarity 'not optional'
items.description: Three Nationals senators have been forced to quit their frontbench positions after breaking shadow cabinet rules. Follow live.

items.title: Three senior Nationals quit frontbench after defying shadow cabinet on hate speech laws
items.description: Senior Nationals Bridget McKenzie, Ross Cadell and Susan McDonald quit the shadow cabinet, after defying its position on the government's hate speech reforms in a late-night vote on Tuesday.

items.title: Mother of teenager found dead on K'gari says life 'will never be the same'
items.description: The body of Canadian Piper James was found on K'gari (Fraser Island) surrounded by a pack of dingoes after she told friends she was going for an early morning swim.

items.title: Live: Gold surges, ASX falls as 'sell America' trade and Trump's threats sink Wall St
items.description: The Australian share market has fallen for a third straight day as Wall Street tumbled to a one-month low on worsening relations between the US and Europe. Follow live.

items.title: Scientists launch deep-sea mission to validate 'dark oxygen' discovery

featured_image.name: World-first deep-ocean landers to hunt down origins of dark ...

items.description:
Researchers have unveiled two specially designed deep-sea landers that will descend nearly seven miles beneath the Pacific Ocean to investigate the controversial phenomenon known as "dark oxygen," a discovery that could reshape understanding of how life emerged on Earth and complicate plans for commercial seabed mining.

At a press conference in London on Tuesday, Professor Andrew Sweetman of the Scottish Association for Marine Science (SAMS) introduced the landers named Alisa and Kaia, after his daughters, which are engineered to withstand pressures 1,200 times greater than those at the surface. The expedition, funded by a £2 million grant from The Nippon Foundation over three years, marks the most detailed examination yet of a process that defies the long-held scientific consensus that oxygen requires sunlight and photosynthesis to form.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: European leaders call for independence from U.S. at Davos

featured_image.name: Macron tells Davos of a 'shift towards a world without rules' | Reuters

items.description:
The World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland, has become a flashpoint for rising U.S.-European tensions as President Donald Trump prepares to address global leaders on Wednesday amid an escalating dispute over Greenland and new tariff threats against longtime allies.

European leaders struck a defiant tone on Tuesday, the second day of the forum, as European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen called for a "permanent" shift toward European independence from the United States and French President Emmanuel Macron warned of a dangerous "shift towards a world without rules."[1][2]

items.title: Iran's parliament warns of jihad if Supreme Leader attacked

featured_image.name: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei: Iran's supreme leader faces his ...

items.description:
Iran's parliament issued a stark warning on Tuesday that any attack on Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei would trigger a declaration of jihad, or holy war, with the mobilization of Islamic fighters worldwide. The statement, from the national security committee of Iran's parliament, raises the stakes in a rapidly escalating confrontation between Tehran and Washington following a deadly crackdown on protests.[1][2]

"Any aggression against the Supreme Leader signifies a declaration of war against the entire Islamic community and necessitates a Jihad proclamation from Islamic scholars, along with the mobilization of Islam's fighters worldwide," the parliamentary committee stated, according to the Iranian Students News Agency.[2][1]

items.title: Mexico transfers 37 cartel suspects to US amid pressure from Trump

featured_image.name: Mexico, under pressure from Trump, transfers 26 more cartel ...

items.description:
Mexico has transferred another 37 drug cartel members to the United States, the country's security minister announced Tuesday, as the Trump administration continues to pressure governments to crack down on criminal networks smuggling drugs across the border.

Mexican Security Minister Omar García Harfuch confirmed the transfer in a social media post on X, describing the individuals as "high impact criminals" who "represented a real threat to the country's security." The handover brings the total number of cartel operatives and leaders sent to the United States under President Claudia Sheinbaum's administration to 92.[1][2][3]

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
